item.title: Ubuntu 11.10
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:47, topic:418134”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=520682.msg3785781#msg3785781 date=1318857903]

They never intended to keep the classic desktop to begin with. Ubuntu 11.04 was still using GNOME 2 so it made sense but now they’re using GNOME 3 and it would be retarded to keep a GNOME 2 DE available. And they aren’t forcing anything on you either. If you don’t want to use it, then don’t. Go install KDE, XFCE, LXDE or something else. And those pictures were showing off some of the new features and just some installed applications.

And Unity is improving a lot if you’d care to notice.

Unity isn’t GNOME 3. You still haven’t given solid proof as to why it is better. No one with any linux experience wants to use that ugly ass DE. I haven’t used GNOME, KDE or XFCE in a long time because they’re too heavy, so why do you think i would use something thats a mix betweeen OSX and Windows 8? Please give me solid proof why its “better and improving”
[/quote]If you think XFCE is heavy then you’re retarded. And Ubuntu is still using GNOME 3, just instead of gnome-shell, they used Unity.

And if you want proof as to why 11.10 is an improvement over 11.04 then just use both of them.[/quote]

XFCE is heavy compared to many of its other alternatives. I don’t need a DE, so just a WM is fine. To name a few, openbox and pekwm are much much much lighter, and can be themed to look just as nice, if not nicer than the others. Just because it’s lighter than GNOME or KDE doesn’t mean its a lightweight DE.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 11.10
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:44, topic:418134”][quote author=RSCShadow link=topic=520682.msg3785776#msg3785776 date=1318857434]
They never intended to keep the classic desktop to begin with. Ubuntu 11.04 was still using GNOME 2 so it made sense but now they’re using GNOME 3 and it would be retarded to keep a GNOME 2 DE available. And they aren’t forcing anything on you either. If you don’t want to use it, then don’t. Go install KDE, XFCE, LXDE or something else. And those pictures were showing off some of the new features and just some installed applications.

And Unity is improving a lot if you’d care to notice.
[/quote]

Unity isn’t GNOME 3. You still haven’t given solid proof as to why it is better. No one with any linux experience wants to use that ugly ass DE. I haven’t used GNOME, KDE or XFCE in a long time because they’re too heavy, so why do you think i would use something thats a mix betweeen OSX and Windows 8? Please give me solid proof why its “better and improving”[/quote]If you think XFCE is heavy then you’re retarded. And Ubuntu is still using GNOME 3, just instead of gnome-shell, they used Unity.

And if you want proof as to why 11.10 is an improvement over 11.04 then just use both of them.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 11.10
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

They never intended to keep the classic desktop to begin with. Ubuntu 11.04 was still using GNOME 2 so it made sense but now they’re using GNOME 3 and it would be retarded to keep a GNOME 2 DE available. And they aren’t forcing anything on you either. If you don’t want to use it, then don’t. Go install KDE, XFCE, LXDE or something else. And those pictures were showing off some of the new features and just some installed applications.

And Unity is improving a lot if you’d care to notice.

Read full topic

item.title: Ubuntu 11.10
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:41, topic:418134”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=520682.msg3785735#msg3785735 date=1318853758]

[quote]I wouldn’t necessarily call that a feature that makes it great… More of an attempt to unify everything. Similar to Apple and now Microsoft…[/quote]What feature?

Unity. It’s more of a downfall right now, and I don’t think they even care about making it better
[/quote]That’s exactly why they, oh yeah, just made it better?[/quote]

Explain how they made it better? All I see is canonical turning into Apple. They’re trying to unify their desktop, and force it upon you. Sure you can always install a new DE, but how long until they force you to use Unity? It certainly can’t be far away if they’ve already dropped the classic fallback. And please no more pictures. They mean absolutely nothing, when a wall of text will suffice.

Read full topic
